name: Louis XIV
what_did:
Louis XIV ruled France for 72 years — longer than any other European king.
He built the famous Palace of Versailles and made France very powerful.
He called himself the 'Sun King' because he believed everything revolved around him.
why_matters:
Louis XIV helped shape the idea of absolute monarchy, where the king had all the power.
His reign changed how kings and governments worked in Europe.
He also supported art, music, and fashion.

fun_fact: Louis XIV started wearing high-heeled shoes to look taller — and made them fashionable!
